title: [$250] Tags - App freezes on import tags page when download backup is cancelled

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.47-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1880/folder/13176676/41236544/1002489875?p=2 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck117251@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch Hybrid app & sign in with gmail account 2. Create workspace >> More features >> enable tags 3. Navigate to Tags option 4. Add few tags 5. Tap More >> Import spreadsheet 6. Select either Single level of tags or Multi-level tags (upgrade to control WS) 7. Click "download a backup" link 8. Cancel the download (do not save CSV export) 9. Click Cancel (or Switch Tag Levels) 10. Try clicking either Multi-level tags, Single level tags or back button in import tags page ## Expected Result: App should not freeze on import tags page after cancelling tags download backup. User should able to go back to add tag page ## Actual Result: App freezes on import tags page when download backup is cancelled ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bf0d28a1-5f25-4162-afe5-05f41aaff3d2 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Bug is reproduced for French language for example. Set language to French 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Login with a new gmail account 3. Create a workspace 4. Go to reports - filters 5. In type section, note last option " workspace" is shown in English 6. Tap on workspace 7. Note header text workspace also displayed in English ## Expected Result: Both the option label and header should be translated to French as “Espace de travail.” ## Actual Result: When the app language is set to French, the last option under the “Type” section and its header are still displayed as “Workspace” in English. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e2fb2b51-a321-442b-b2c8-d66ed7ef5ea3 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to any conversation or workspace chat 3. Type "@" in the compose box 4. If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.46-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72756 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** odinsjnsdojsosjdo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Have two non-default workspaces and no default workspace - Have self DM 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM 3. Click + > Create expense > Manual 4. Enter amount > Next 5. On confirm page, click Category field 6. On workspace selector page, select any workspace 7. On category list, click RHP back button → Workspace selector page does not open because default workspace has been selected - Expected 8. Create another workspace and delete the default workspace 9. Go to self DM 10. Create an expense without category 11. Open the expense thread 12. Click Category 13. On workspace selector page, select any workspace 14. On category list, click RHP back button ## Expected Result: Workspace selector page will not open (like Step 7) and RHP will dismiss ## Actual Result: Workspace selector page reopens despite having selected the default workspace ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.46-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @cristipaval **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1762525902216149) ## Action Performed: 1. Have an expense in a report from Workspace A with TagA applied 2. Have Workspace B with multi-level tags, where TagA is not available (uses a different tag set) and empty report 3. Move the expense from Workspace A’s report to a report in Workspace B. ## Expected Result: A “Tag no longer valid” violation should appear since the tag applied to the expense does not exist in the new workspace. ## Actual Result: No violation is displayed even though the tag is invalid for the new workspace. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.46-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1856/folder/13176670/45748766/999689654 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1 72old.approver@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Open workpace settings 3. Enable per diem feature and import per diem rates 4. Create a per diem expense Algeria - overnight - 999999999999 5. Complete the flow 6. Note user can create per diem expense with big amount without error 7. Tap more - Split expense 8. Tap save ## Expected Result: If the system allows creation of a Per Diem expense with a large amount, it should also allow splitting that expense without any error. ## Actual Result: *User is able to create a Per Diem expense with a very large amount (e.g., 999999999999) without any error. *However, when attempting to split the same expense and tapping Save, an unexpected error occurs. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e6ef2ec-c0a8-4dfc-a8fb-78d762bc8bce [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
